channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside Brook Drive 32, 9th December
item.description:
There is rubbish from the house spilling out over the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Brook Drive, Elephant and Castle, Greater London

item.title: Flooded pathway, 9th December
item.description:
The path has flooded again in the subway, due to leave blocking the drainage. This is the only safe route to a number of local schools (without crossing a main road) for young children.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown hedge, 9th December
item.description:
There is an issue with a hedge in the tree line of the road (i.e. on the roadside of the pavement - and so we understand that it is a council planted hedge). It is outside 38 Christchurch Road. It has overgrown to a large extent meaning that it completely blocks the view of the road when coming off of the driveway of 36 Christchurch Road. This is unsafe as it becomes guesswork as to whether it is safe to set off from the driveway. Please can this hedge be trimmed significantly. For reference, please compare to other hedges further down the road. I had previously reported this (ref: 8130849), but I could not see that any action had been taken even though it was flagged as resolved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christchurch Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Flytipping yet again, 9th December

item.title: Kilburn high road opposite burton road, 9th December
item.description:
Despite previously reporting this dangerous pothole numerous times (some of which have been reported as fixed!), this pothole remains unfixed and causing significant congestion and tailbacks on the Kilburn high road. How can you possibly not have fixed this by now. Where are our tax payers money going?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn High Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle left for 1 werk - causing obstruction and untaxed, 9th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadheath Drive, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Flooded road, 9th December
item.description:
The path and road between the Kent Hall Hotel and Portland Rise is unevenly laid and has no drainage. Every time it rains, there are huge puddles of filthy water on the road and the pavement. This is my second time this week being soaked by a passing bus.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Seven Sisters Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
